description._content: Bain News Service,, publisher. Walter Damrosch, Columbia [1914 June 3] 1 negative : glass ; 5 x 7 in. or smaller. Notes: Title from data provided by the Bain News Service on the negative. Photograph shows German-American conductor Walter Johannes Damrosch (1862-1950) who received an honorary Doctor of Music at Commencement Day at Columbia University, New York City, June 3, 1914. Third man on the right is possibly Richard Gottheil (1862-1936) who was a professor of Semitic languages and rabbinical literature at Columbia. (Source: Flickr Commons project, 2011, 2012 and New York Times, June 3 and 4, 1914) Forms part of: George Grantham Bain Collection (Library of Congress). Format: Glass negatives. Rights Info: No known restrictions on publication. Repository: Library of Congress, Prints and Photographs Division, Washington, D.C. 20540 USA, hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/pp.print General information about the Bain Collection is available at hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/pp.ggbain Higher resolution image is available (Persistent URL): hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/ggbain.16162 Call Number: LC-B2- 3078-5
